content.en: High-speed wireless encryption: Researchers have been investigating ways to achieve fast and secure wireless connectivity in IEEE 802.11 networks by offloading computational intensive cryptographic processes to algorithms. They have also explored the use of FPGA chips to realize high throughput AES cipher processors, and proposed the Parallel Sub-Pipelined architecture (PSP) to obtain high throughput in AES algorithms. Additionally, efficient hardware architectures and techniques such as parallel operation, folded parallel architecture, and 2-slow retiming have been used to achieve high throughput in the hardware implementation of AES algorithms for various applications.
content.da: Højhastigheds trådløs kryptering: Forskere har undersøgt måder at opnå hurtig og sikker trådløs forbindelse i IEEE 802.11 netværk ved at aflaste beregningstunge kryptografiske processer til algoritmer. De har også udforsket brugen af FPGA-chips til at realisere høj gennemstrømning i AES-krypteringsprocessorer og foreslået parallel subpipelinering (PSP) arkitektur for at opnå høj gennemstrømning i AES-algoritmer. Derudover er effektive hardwarearkitekturer og teknikker som parallel drift, foldet parallel arkitektur og 2-slow gentiming blevet anvendt for at opnå høj gennemstrømning i hardwareimplementeringen af AES-algoritmer til forskellige anvendelser.
